gurmukhi: ਹਸੇ ਬੀਰ ਬੈਤਾਲ ਅੌ ਸੁੱਧ ਸਿੱਧੰ || ਚਵੀ ਚਾਵਡੀਯੰ ੳੁਡੀ ਗ੍ਰਿੱਧ ਬ੍ਰਿਧੰ ||੨੮||
transliteration: Hase Boor Baitaal Au Suddh Siddhan|| Chavoo Chaavadooyan Udoo Griddh Briddhan||28||
translation: The Birs (heroic spirits), Baitals (ghosts) and Siddhs (adepts) laughed, the witches were talking and huge kites were flying (for meat).28.

gurmukhi: ਹਰੀਚੰਦ ਕੋਪੇ ਕਮਾਣੰ ਸੰਭਾਰੰ || ਪ੍ਰਥਮ ਬਾਜੀਯੰ ਤਾਣ ਬਾਣੰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੰ ||
transliteration: Daroochannd Kope Kamaanan Sanbhaaran|| Pratham Baajooyan Taan Baanan Prahaaran||
translation: Hari Chand, filled with rage, drew out his bow, he aimed and shot his arrow, which struck my horse.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਤੀਯ ਤਾਕ ਕੈ ਤੀਰ ਮੋ ਕੌ ਚਲਾਯੰ || ਰਖਿਓ ਦੲੀਵ ਮੈ ਕਾਨ ਛ੍ਵੈ ਕੈ ਸਿਧਾਯੰ ||੨੯||
transliteration: Doutooyataak Kai Toor Mo Kau Chalaayan|| Rakhio Daoov Mai Kaan Chhvai Kai Sidhaayan||29||
translation: He aimed and shot the second arrow towards me, the Lord protected me, his arrow only grazed my ear. 29.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਿਤੀਯ ਬਾਣ ਮਾਰਿਯੋ ਸੁ ਪੇਟੀ ਮਝਾਰੰ || ਬਿਧਿਅੰ ਚਿਲਕਤੰ ਦੁਅਾਲ ਪਾਰੰ ਪਧਾਰੰ ||
transliteration: Tritooya Baan Maariyo Su Petoo Majhaaran|| Bidhian Chilkatan Duaal Paaran Padhaaran||
translation: His third arrow penetrated deep into the buckle of my waist-belt.

gurmukhi: ਚੁਭੀ ਚਿੰਚ ਚਰਮੰ ਕਛੂ ਘਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਯੰ || ਕਲੰ ਕੇਵਲੰ ਜਾਨ ਦਾਸੰ ਬਚਾਯੰ ||੩੦||
transliteration: Choubhi Chinch Charamannd Kachhodh Ghaae Na Aayan|| Kalan Kevalan Jaan Daasan Bachaayan||30||
translation: Its edge touched the body, but did not caused a wound, the Lord saved his servent.30.

gurmukhi: ਜਬੈ ਬਾਣ ਲਾਗਯੋ || ਤਬੈ ਰੋਸ ਜਾਗਯੋ ||
transliteration: Jabai Baan Laagyo|| Tabai Ros Jaagyo||
translation: When the edge of the arrow touched my body, it kindled my resentment.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੰ ਲੈ ਕਮਾਣੰ || ਹਨੰ ਬਾਣ ਤਾਣੰ ||੩੧||
transliteration: Karan Lai Kamaanan|| Hanan Baan Taanan||31||
translation: I took the bow in my hand and aimed and shot the arrow.31.
All the warriors fled, when a volley of arrow was showered.

gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਤਾਕਿ ਬਾਣੰ || ਹਨਯੋ ੲੇਕ ਜੁਅਾਣੰ ||੩੨||
transliteration: Tabai Taak(i) Baanan|| Hanyo Ek Juaanan||32||
translation: Then I aimed the arrow on a warrior and killed him.32.
Hari Chand was killed and his brave soldiers were trampled.
The chief of Kot Lehar was seized by death.33.

gurmukhi: ਰਣੰ ਤਿਅਾਗਿ ਭਾਗੇ || ਸਬੈ ਤ੍ਰਾਸ ਪਾਗੇ ||
transliteration: Ranan Tiaag(i) Bhaage|| Sabai Traas Paage||
translation: The hill-men fled from the battlefield, all were filled with fear.

gurmukhi: ਭੲੀ ਜੀਤ ਮੋਰੀ || ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਕਾਲ ਕੇਰੀ ||੩੪||
transliteration: Bhaoo Jeet Meroo|| Kridaa Kaal Keroo||34||
translation: I gained victory through the favour of the Eternal Lord (KAL).34.
